labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

candidates.title: [Voice Model] Get rid of enum_primitive dep

labels.name: voice
labels.description: Related to the `voice` module and `serenity_voice_model` crate.

candidates.body: `enum_primitive` is unmaintained and causes duplicate `num-traits` dependencies, and just a simple macro crate.

candidates.title: Replace `serenity::json::prelude` with public wrapper functions

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

candidates.body:
To avoid future breakage, we shouldn't re-export functions from dependency libs in case a function signature changes, which would pass on breaking changes to serenity's users. Providing wrapper functions solves this issue.

Note: changed `from_str`to take `&str` instead of `String`, and simply clone it for the `simd_json` case. This means the more common `serde_json` use case no longer requires ownership (or an extra clone before passing the string in).

candidates.title: Fix CI on `next`

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

candidates.body: Fix clippy failure introduced after #2544. Also, fixes the `minimal-versions` check by setting the lower bound on proc-macro2 to be v1.0.60.

candidates.title: Bump bitflags to 2.x

labels.name: voice
labels.description: Related to the `voice` module and `serenity_voice_model` crate.

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

candidates.body:
In bitflags 2.x, bitflag structs changed to tuple structs and can't be instantiated the same way as before. Unfortunately, performing bitops on them isn't possible in `const` contexts, so a workaround is to perform them on the raw `.bits()` and pass the result to `from_bits_truncate`.

Also, bitflag structs no longer automatically derive the following traits: `Clone`, `Copy`, `Debug`, `Default`, `Hash`, `PartialEq`, `Eq`, `PartialOrd`, and `Ord`. To avoid breaking backcompat, I added them back, but serenity does not rely on all of them. Nothing relies on `PartialOrd`/`Ord`, and only the `Permissions` and `SpeakingState` types rely on `Hash`/`PartialEq`/`Eq`. The common required traits are just `Copy`/`Clone` and `Debug`. It's worth considering if we should remove extra impls for types which we expect won't ever make use of them in user code.

candidates.title: Bump dependency versions

labels.name: voice
labels.description: Related to the `voice` module and `serenity_voice_model` crate.

candidates.body:
* simd-json 0.7 -> 0.10
* tokio-tungstenite 0.19 -> 0.20
* ed25519-dalek 1.0 -> 2.0
* criterion 0.4 -> 0.5
* notify 5.0.0-pre.14 -> 6.1

In tungstenite 0.20, the `WebSocketConfig::max_send_queue` is deprecated for `max_write_buffer_length`. The default value corresponds to an unlimited length, same as before. However, there's a new `write_buffer_length` field which controls how much buffering is done before a flush occurs and the buffer gets written to the underlying system. It defaults to 128KiB (so 128 * 1024) - is this a fine value for us to use?

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

candidates.title: Deserialize to ArrayString instead of String for ImageHash
candidates.body:
This saves an allocation on creation of `ImageHash`, but adds a new dependency that is not currently in the dep tree at all.

I chose the `arrayvec` crate over `smallvec`, `tinyvec`, or `heapless` as:
- `smallvec` will fall over to heap allocation if length exceeds the capacity
- `tinyvec` and `smallvec` does not include an `ArrayString`
- `heapless` contains a lot of unnecessary data structures that may bloat compile time

candidates.title: Use secrecy::SecretString instead of manual debug implementation

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

candidates.body: This fixes some mismatches between Debug implementations and the underlying struct, which were caught by `clippy::missing_fields_in_debug`. This PR also means that webhook/bot tokens are going to be zeroed when dropped, as a security measure.

candidates.title: Replace `once_cell::sync::OnceCell` with `std::sync::OnceLock`

labels.name: breaking change

candidates.body: Newly stabilized in 1.70. Allows us to remove `once_cell` as a dependency.
